intro: Placolobium ellipticum, commonly known as the narrow-leafed milkweed, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Apocynaceae family, which includes many milkweed species known for their milky sap. The plant features narrow, elliptical leaves and produces clusters of small, yellowish-green flowers. It is often found in grasslands and rocky areas, thriving in well-drained soils. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
